title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
OB: Currently, when a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure and points the output folder at a bin directory, the system does not confirm that the bin directory can be deleted then rebuilt. As a result, some users are creating projects with output folders pointing at a bin directory that contains more than just .class files which can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
EB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure and points the output folder at a bin directory, the software should confirm that the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt. This confirmation will prevent users from creating projects with output folders pointing at a bin directory that contains unnecessary files.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the software and navigate to the project creation interface. 
2. Choose 'Use existing directory structure' option. 
3. Select a bin directory as the output folder. 
4. Proceed to create the project. 

The software should display a confirmation dialog stating that the bin directory will be deleted and recreated during the project creation process. It should also provide the option to proceed or cancel the project creation.
